Description: Rim and upper body sherd (mended from three fragments and added plaster) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; glaze mostly fired mid-brown; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; possible billet band in added white near rim above band of alternating red and white tongues; below, white dots on red band between pairs of white lines; exterior: diagonal stroke pattern at rim; below, paired hook maeander pattern between pairs of lines; below, on left, painted decoration consisting of head of hound with collar, to right; at right, part of undetermined decoration; painted inscription in field.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.847 and it is mentioned in Boardman, J. 'Chian and Naukratite', Annual of the British School at Athens 51, 1956, 57, note 1.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 297, no. 982)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 60, pl. 35, no. 26)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 783)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1997) (phase 2)
